value:
Why are there other men here who
so strongly resemble me?$k$pI'll admit I feel a connection to them,
though. Even the one with the mask...

Emperor Rudolf is like a father to me.
I'd have remained at his side had his
orders not led me to the Deliverance.

I know well the unease that comes
with finding oneself in a foreign land.
Do not let it trouble you much.

Tatiana and I are meeting for tea, if
you would like to join. She said she
would be baking a cake as well.

Have you seen Tatiana, by chance?
We were to meet here, but I fear she
has gotten lost in the castle halls...

I've come with fond greetings from
$Nf. Might you
be $Nu?

My daily training continues to bear
fruit.

I could do better, yes... But I daresay
not many could, so I believe this is
satisfactory.

Forgive me... I'm just not myself
today.

You would grant me this power?
I am honored.

I have yet to regain my memories,
including my real name... But for now,
you may call me Zeke.

I have not failed to notice or
appreciate the attention you have
paid me since I was summoned here.$k$pYou remind me of the emperor in his
prime. Despite his position, he took in
a stranger like me.$k$pRudolf has taken my true father's
place in the void that is my memory.
I intend to repay everything in kind.$k$pBut many twists of fate have taken
me far from his side—once to the
Deliverance, and now to Askr.$k$pMy fate is out of my control. But I can
promise that I will serve you as
honorably as I served him.
はあっ
逃がさん！
くっ…
バカな…！
Think you can beat me?
You're out of luck.
Have you said your prayers?
Do not think badly of me.
Forgive me, Tatiana...
ふっ…
My name is Zeke. It is true that I'm a warrior of Rigel, but I have my reasons for fighting for the Deliverance now.
Hm? Oh, it's you. Ha... The way you tug on my sleeve reminds me of Tatiana.
I still have no recollection of who I am or from whence I came.
Simply being with Tatiana puts my mind at ease. She may be a bit clumsy, but she always does her best.
Emperor Rudolf accepted as a father does his own son. I could never betray that trust.
Her face is dim, but it is there, etched in the recesses of memory. The face of my... My...
In this world, you are my lord, and thus I swear my fealty as a knight to you.
Very well.
Hmm...
Embrace your fate.
